info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 10:55AM MST until January 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: .Blizzard conditions will continue to spread into northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska this afternoon as winds increase. Gusts over 50 mph will become common by mid afternoon resulting in considerable blowing and drifting. Snow amounts will generally be 4 to 8 inches, however over a foot of snow is likely in a heavy band that has developed in Gove, Logan and Wallace counties in northwest Kansas. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...In Colorado, Yuma County. In Nebraska, Dundy County. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Patchy blowing snow possible, especially near the Kansas state line.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
